info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:09AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN GUERNSEY... SOUTHWESTERN BELMONT AND NORTHEASTERN NOBLE COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1208 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Byesville, or 9 miles east of Cambridge, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Barnesville, Bethesda, Antrim, Quaker City, Belmont, Lore City, Morristown, Old Washington, Salesville, Wilson, Somerton, and Fairview. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 181 and 211. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
